main.node

Class OrdinalDecisionNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.node.OrdinalDecisionNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Node

    public class OrdinalDecisionNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements Node
    This class implements the Node interface and is made to deal with any Numeric data. Both types of decision nodes are intended to accept some data and make a decision that will help classify the data.
    Author:
    Dan Martin

      OrdinalDecisionNode(float breakValue, int dataIndex, java.lang.String attribute)
      This constructs an OrdinalDecisionNode that will make a decision using the dataIndex and breakValue.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrdinalDecisionNode

        public OrdinalDecisionNode(float breakValue,
                           int dataIndex,
                           java.lang.String attribute)
        This constructs an OrdinalDecisionNode that will make a decision using the dataIndex and breakValue.
        Parameters:
        breakValue - if a dataPoint has this value at the correct index then it will route the data right.
        dataIndex - this is the index that the node will look to compare the breakValue to.
        attribute - this is the name of the attribute that the node will be making decisions with.
